A fellow elder. From sun and presbuteros; a co-presbyter.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
A sharer, partner, companion. From koinos; a sharer, i.e. Associate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

1.str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.

1.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

2.str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

A little flock. Neuter of a presumed derivative of poimne; a flock, i.e. group.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: To exercise oversight, care for, visit. From epi and skopeo; to oversee; by implication, to beware.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
By way of compulsion, unwillingly, by force, necessarily. Adverb from a derivative of anagkazo; compulsorily.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Willingly, of one's own accord, spontaneously. Adverb from the same as hekousion; voluntarily.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
Greedily, in a spirit of eagerness for base gain. Adverb from aischrokerdes; sordidly.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Readily, eagerly, with a ready mind, cheerfully. Adverb from prothumos; with alacrity.

3.str2: And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: To exercise authority over, overpower, master. From kata and kurieuo; to lord against, i.e. Control, subjugate.
(a) a lot, (b) a portion assigned; hence: a portion of the people of God assigned to one's care, a congregation.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From tupto; a die, i.e. a stamp or scar; by analogy, a shape, i.e. A statue, style or resemblance; specially, a sampler, i.e. A model or instance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A little flock. Neuter of a presumed derivative of poimne; a flock, i.e. group.

4.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The chief shepherd. From arche and poimen; a head shepherd.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
4.str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

4.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
4.str2: From a primary komeo; properly, to provide for, i.e. to carry off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Unfading, fadeless, enduring. From amarantos; 'amaranthine', i.e. fadeless.

5.str2: In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.

5.str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

5.str2: To clothe oneself (originally: To tie round in a knot).

5.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural

From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Humble, lowly, in position or spirit (in a good sense). Of uncertain derivation; depressed, i.e. humiliated.

6.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
6.str2: To make or bring low, humble, humiliate; pass: To be humbled. From tapeinos; to depress; figuratively, to humiliate.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Strong, powerful, mighty. From kratos; powerful.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
